items.title: You
items.comment: Informal 'you' used in daily conversation.

items.title: I / Me
items.comment: Used to refer to oneself. Example: '我是学生' (I am a student).

items.title: Good / Hello
items.comment: Can mean 'good' or be used in greetings like 你好 (Hello).

items.title: Correct / Yes
items.comment: Used to confirm something is correct.

items.title: No / Not
items.comment: A negation word used before verbs and adjectives.

items.title: Rise / Start
items.comment: Used in phrases like 对不起 (duìbuqǐ) meaning 'sorry.'

items.title: Not / Without
items.comment: Used in negation of past actions. Example: 我没去 (Wǒ méi qù) - 'I didn't go.'

items.title: Relation / Connection
items.comment: Used in 没关系 (méi guānxi) meaning 'No problem.'

items.title: You (formal)
items.comment: Polite form of 你 (nǐ).

items.title: Plural marker
items.comment: Used to make pronouns plural, e.g., 你们 (nǐmen) - 'you all.'

items.title: Thanks
items.comment: Used in 谢谢 (xièxie) meaning 'thank you.'

items.title: Again
items.comment: Used in 再见 (zàijiàn) meaning 'goodbye.'

items.title: See / Meet
items.comment: Used in 再见 (zàijiàn) meaning 'see you again.'

items.title: Eat
items.comment: Used in phrases like 吃饭 (chīfàn) meaning 'eat food.'

items.title: Rice / Meal
items.comment: Often refers to meals in general.

items.title: Completed action marker
items.comment: Indicates a completed action.

items.title: Hello (on phone)
items.comment: Used when answering a phone call.

items.title: Exchange / Change
items.comment: Used in phrases like 换钱 (huàn qián) meaning 'exchange money.'

items.title: This
items.comment: Used to indicate something close. Example: 这是 (zhè shì) - 'This is.'

items.title: One
items.comment: The number 1 in Chinese.

items.title: Very
items.comment: Used to intensify adjectives, e.g., 很好 (hěn hǎo) - 'very good.'

items.title: Question particle
items.comment: Used to turn statements into yes/no questions.

items.title: Tiger
items.comment: Refers to the animal 'tiger' and is also used metaphorically to symbolize bravery and power in Chinese culture.
